name: First Criminal - deprecated
description: This is my first Criminal deck build. I ran with v0 of it once, then swapped out a few cards (Toolbox was too much, swapped in peacock for a gordian) and ended up with this. Counting both runs, it's 1-1. It has reasonable economy, but not a lot of forcing function if corp is playing slow (that's why I added the nerve agent). And I suspect maybe I have too many one-offs, should probably cut it down all the way to 45. I'd happily take advice from others.

name: Quiet Rioteer (Looking For Feedback)
description:
the basic premise here is versatility with the ability to build creds on kati and then dump a bunch of stuff on personal workshop and pay for it AFTER trashing jackson howard, mill like 4 cards during the run to increase the chance of finding victory.

Really hoping for some help I play kate and gabe and want to get competitive with noise.

name: Power Shutdown Jinteki
description:
Designed to slow the runner down by trashing breakers either in hand via net damage or on the board via power shutdown. The trick is to play power shutdown as much as possible until those pesky corroders are gone (or the clone chips etc). Recur them using jackson and precog to find them quickly (as well as making r&d far less appealing). Full operation economy and cheap etr ICE should leave plenty of cash to use Corporate troubleshooter to hit hard with a roto/grim/archer or chum into katana for a flatline.

Very possible for barriers to become unbreakable in the late game if the runner has little recursion, which is likely in this andycentric meta, so don't trash them unless absolutely needed.

name: Kati Cheap events (looking  for help)
description: make a lot of money by playing events really cheap so test running that femme is free, inside job is free, etc.

name: Andromeda Prepays
description: Doing what criminal does best. Run events, now dirty laundry is pure money, inside job is free, sure gamble can net you 7 credits, running interference is ONE credit, quality time is free.

name: Reina Fire (Wrecking your day)
description: generally ruin their day by milling tons of cards or locking their econ.

name: IceStorm 1.0
description: Utilizing NEXT to get the most out of the ID, in an attempt to push past the Early game as quickly as possible (with luck, after the first corp turn) to set the runner's back as much as possible

name: IceStorm 1.1
description:
Adjusting here - Moving up for Economy (2 Gila hands) - 1pts Agendas that can be Scored out of Hand after Mandatory Upgrades is good, plus the economy will be helpful - Melange is great, but you have to trash melange to score most of the time. Gila will help with that.

Also means you will probably be sitting at 5 points quickly (Mandatory Upgrades, ABT, Gila Hands) and threatening to win on any turn because of MU - so you can drop your ice onto RD and tax the runner for every run, hopefully to the point where they are only able to run every other turn or so. Giving you plenty of time to find the last agenda and score it.

Possibly still considering 45 card version (Drop Rototurret, 1 Grim, Oversight AI, 1 Melange) but think that the Oversight is good for the times you draw into Heim/Wotan (and an early Oversight Wotan is a run stopper, period)

Worried a little bit about lack of 'Mid Game' ice - str 4+ ice with ETR/Devestating abilities to tax the runnerthat are less than 7 credits (Currently: Grim, Ichi 1.0, Viper) but not a lot of other choices

name: Dodgy Calculations
description: The deck is designed to lure the runner into running and then hitting into upgrades to massively increase their costs at the final hurdle, potentially wasting their resources and then allowing corp to score an agenda.

name: rush4it
description:
Inspired by this article I decided to build a deck which threatens to win from hand after rushing two 2pt agendas first.

Gameplan:

  • rush Efficiency Committee as soon as possible behind two different cheap ETR ice
  • score a quick 2 pointer
  • score a 3 pointer from hand (install, advance, take EC tokens, 2xShipment from SanSan)

I played only 3 games with this deck, but won all of them - exactly in a way described above. Jacksons and Anonymous Tips are to make sure you get the cards you need when you need them.

name: The Masked Whale v1.2
description:
Your basic Whizzard/Darwin deck. Everything revolves around getting Darwin up and growing ASAP. Personal Touches keep him at a respectable strength should the Corp purge virus counters and Surge speeds up the growth process should you need it. Feedback Implants keep the cost of breaking multi-sub ice down.

I threw in Mimic as a counter to Swordsman. Hence the name of the deck.

name: A Thousand Tiny Knives
description:
Knife damage, it's coming.

(I haven't playtested this yet but it looks fun)

name: First Criminal
description: This is my first Criminal deck build, updated with suggestions from x3r0h0ur. It comes in a bit leaner, with a little more flexibility on the icebreaker side, and a bit more payoff for HQ runs. Where it's a little weaker is in its ability to counter traces, so Gabe'll mostly need to avoid or just outspend those.

name: Off the Grid HB
description: Is it possible to make this Off the Grid HB deck work? Here's a last minute attempt that did pretty well during game night; however, it has yet to under go the "criminal" test.

name: Red Queen's Gambit
description: Atman?!?!?! Mostly to ensure HQ access but can be helpful when dealing with archers, neural katanas, etc. I tried influence elsewhere, but this was actually more consistent than you think. They also begin thinking I run an atman deck.
